Events.Text: hello!
You remember that your friend recommended the Shadyside Inn. Tell the assistant you've changed your mind and want to stay at Shadyside Inn. [instruction 1 of 5]
How can I help
How can I help you?
Hello, how can I help?
I need to reserve a room at the Old Town Inn.
What is your name?
May I have your name, please?
Actually, I'm sorry, my friend reccommended the Shadyside Inn. I want to stay there. I'm Alexis.

Actually, you recall that your friend stayed at Shadyside Inn in another town. However you've read on a blog that the Hyatt Hotel is by long and far the most authentic one. Tell the assistant you've changed your mind and want to stay at Hyatt Hotel. [instruction 2 of 5]
What date are you arriving?
When are you arriving?
Oops, I read on a blog that the Hyatt is the best hotel. I'd like to stay there instead! Sorry about that!
Talk to the assistant about this great travel blog that you rely on and that its never let you down on your journeys. Be creative! [instruction 3 of 5]
When are you arriving?
When are you arriving?
I totally rely on this blog. It's never let me down. I want to arrive on May 7th.

You just received a text from your partner saying: 'Hey, my brother invited us to his wedding in London on the 16th and I already booked us a flight for the 7th!' Tell the assistant you would like to change your reservation to 11th-30th the following month. [instruction 4 of 5]
When are you leaving?
When will you be leaving again?
Actually, you're right. I want to get the reservation from the 11th to the 30th of next month. We're travelling to London for a wedding!

Tell the assistant you don't really want to go to London because your partner's brother is a bit of a show-off, but obviously you'll be going to the wedding. Finish the booking and bring the conversation to an end. [instruction 5 of 5]
I'm sorry it is unavaiolable
I'm very sorry, but there is no room available at the Hyatt Hotel for your requested dates.
That's okay, I don't really even want to go to London. My brother's partner is a real show off. But obviously I'll still go to the wedding! Thanks, anyway. That'll be all.
Thank you.
Thank you and goodbye.

Scenario.UserTask: You want to reserve a room at the Old Town Inn from May 7th to 16th. Your name is Alexis. Please do not make a custom request, and it is ok if no room is available - just say goodbye in this case.
Scenario.WizardTask: Help the user reserve a hotel room. (You can find the video tutorial under https://youtu.be/USrWF1ZyNWw, in case you want to watch it again.)

UserQuestionnaire.Question: Did the assistant reserve your hotel?
Did the assistant stay calm and helpful throughout the dialogue?

WizardQuestionnaire.Question: Did the user change his/her mind about what he/she wants at any time?
Did the user become aggressive or annoyed during the dialogue? (Note: some users may be instructed to be annoying.)
Where you unsure about what to do at any time? (Feel free to send us an email with details.)
